definition: to tout/to solicit customers
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: The tradesman was vigorously soliciting for my custom.
sentences.chinese: 那个店主极力向我拉生意。

sentences.english: People said that he touted for his mother and sister.
sentences.chinese: 据说，他给母亲和姐姐拉生意。

sentences.english: Doctors compete vigorously to win business using steep discounts.
sentences.chinese: 这类医生也会大打折扣来拉生意。

sentences.english: Are those touting it is a lie. ?
sentences.chinese: 是正在拉生意它的人是一则谎言。？

sentences.english: Beck, it turns out, is a shill for Goldline International, a precious metals concern, that is paying Beck to help generate business into its coffers.
sentences.chinese: 这是一家贵重金属公司，雇佣贝克为其拉生意。

definition: to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
to advertise/to solicit business
to undercut competitors/to hustle/to compete for business
to procure/to act as pimp
to make extra money
to set up a stall/to maintain a large staff and organization
to employ/to hire/to rent
variant of 雇[gu4]
(northern dialect) to pick up a fare (as a taxi driver)/to pick up a piece of work (as a courier)
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
pimp
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to canvas (for customers)/to solicit/to advertise/to drum up/sales pitch/to take on (a task)
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
to market/to sell
extra income
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
